author: michaelvader
title: Get it for the minifig and seeweed part
review:
ok I got this for the minifig so yeah...

pros:
new manta helmet (head)
ugly head (cool)
new body
trident
seeweed part

cons:
to small
needs more parts like the other one

ok get it for the manta dude but small so 4/5

author: Montana_8
title: Great Minifig
review: The minifig in this set is very interesting and detailed, he is like no other Lego figure I own. It makes a great adition to your collect. Also it goes really well with other Atlantis sets. Great Stocking Stuffer.

author: deadtree103
title: Better than it looks.
review:
Despite the bad reviews and the low Peice count, this is still an okay set. The Minifig is great, and he's new to me because he only comes with two other sets(Both of wich are kinda biggish). So it's great to get him in a small set. The rock doesn't really do much for the set, but it does have a new-style headlight brick in Dark Bley :D . And it's a really good army builder, and I'm planning on getting more so I can have a bunch of em swarming my Explorers :D . Oh yeah, and contrary to what most of the pictures make it look like, the head is mostly Light Bley, not white.

PROS :)
*Cheapest way to get the Manta Warrior.
*Headlight brick :D .
*Another trident(I LOVE that weapon).
*Another Dark Green Piraka spine.

CONS :(
*too small.
*Some pictures are misleading about the head color.

I reccomend it anyway.

author: JBH75
title: I got this on an Impulse...
review:
Today, I went to Toys R Us to check if they finally gotten more merchandise after a Christmas sale, and I bought this set along with the Guardian of the Deep (so that I could give the red disk to a mini-fig). For an impulse set, I'd have to say that this set is average. I'll explain in the pros and cons

Pros:
Manta-man, with new body, and head
Flexible Trident
Nice little rock, with seaweed/Piraka Spine
Great army-builder
Cheapest way to get manta man

Cons:
Lack of pieces compared to other impulse sets
Lack of pieces = Overpriced!!
No disk (that doesn't really matter though)

In conclusion, if you want a cheap manta-man to build an army, or get lots of tridents, or seaweeds, buy this. Otherwise, buy the Seabed Scavenger for a Manta Man, as you'll receive more options, fairer price, but above all, a manta-man.
(You could also buy 4 of these and a Scavenger, to have a fair fight)

author: Rock_Raider
title: Manta Warrior
review:
I got this from our local Market, before Christmas!

Minifig: 4/5
The minifig looks great, but the face looks a little strange.
The weapon is unique.

Playability: 2/5
You need something to play with it.
Good army builder.

Design: 1/5
This set is a minifigure set.
The rock piece is useless and you don't do nothing with it!

Build: 2/5
Fast to build.

Parts: 3/5
The minifig and it's weapon is unique.

Overall: 2/5

Pros: Minifig, good army builder.
Cons: Awful rock piece.

author: legospongepotter
title: Small Set
review:
So I only got it for the Minifigure. I also think the trident is cool. Not much you can do with seaweed rock but is a nice touch.

The Manta Warrior's head costume is hard to keep on but with other strange alien monsters, you could make this as the head. I think the actual seaweed is cool but he rock just sits there. Overally a pretty good 'set'

author: ian
title: attack of the freaky deranged manta warriors!
review:
This set is pretty decent, you get a freaky deranged manta warrior( since thats kind of annoying to type i'll call him steve) and a clump of seaweed attached to a rock. Steve is an excellently made minifig. He has tons of detail and his face even without his cool mask is downright creepy. Steve comes with gold trident and thats about it for Steve. The rock is kind of pitiful. I would have preferred a small creature or a treasure chest, but on the upside it does look nice. So get this set if you like awesome minifigures that give small children nightmares or are obsessed with dull scenery items.


 

 
PROS

 
  • minifigure is epic
  • gold trident is cool looking
  • 3 euros is a cheap price so you can make an army of freaky deranged manta warriors.
  • scenery rock thingy is nice
  • It's cheap oh wait I already said that
CONS

 
  • come on a rock warning imagination failure!
  • trident should be longer
all in all if you buy this set you won't regret it but there are better little sets out there

author: Lint
title: Terribly dull
review:
I bought this set because I was interested in the Manta Warrior but did not intent to collect the Atlantis line. I was more dissapointed than I thought I would be dissapointed.

Pros

  • Golden trident
  • Cute angry manta minifig head
  • Manta 'mask' is made of rubbery plastic and very well sculpted

Cons

  • The head articulation is restricted by the mask. I felt they could have redesigned it easily to not do this.
  • The body decos are quite bland and tacky. I see limited applications in MOCs
  • The seaweed-rock is possibly one of the most boring impulse 'accessories' ever. It contains few overall parts and the green seaweed is about as interesting as the parts get (which is to say not at all).
Overall this set is only useful for those who want to build an army of Manta Warriors and nothing else. I would not buy this for your kid. There are plenty of other impulses that will stimulate their brain and provide entertainment value. This set is simply not worth it for the parts. Next time I want a pearl gold trident i'll go to bricklink.

author: Roketah
title: Sting-Ray
review:
I Brought This Set Along With The Sea Jet Are Awesome Together!!

Straight To Pro's And Con's.

 

Pro's

 

Great Fig

Gold Trident

Cool Face And Helmate

 

 

And Now The Easy Part Con's

 

Rubber Trident

A Rock..... Seriously A Rock Could Of Come With A Sea Thing Or Somthing Cool

Rubber Helmate

Price-$5

 

I Would Recomend This Set To Anyone Who Already Has A Atlantis Set, Still Awsome

 

Find It, Buy It!!

author: Brickman_oo_
title: What a letdown...
review: This puny little set shows that it is worth saving money for sets you want. This was a big mistake on my part. This set comes with a rock, and a figure. The figure is kind of cool. That is all. Goodbye:D

author: Phantom
title: There cant possibly be a dumber accsessory than a rock...
review:
Obivously, the main attraction of this, lets say "set" is the Manta warrior, who, is quite a good figure by himself, hes got a hard-rubberish head, not like yoda, but also not like normal plastic heads, luckily, the printings dont peel off however. Overall, he's quite good.

Now onto the second part of the 'set', its a rock, a rock with some green sea weed, its described to 'hide the manta warrior and he will pop out to surprise a diver, if you have one'. REALLY NOW? I can spot a manta warrior behind the rock from a mile away-plain stupid if you ask me.
Theres only one good part to this set, and thats the minifigure, my mom got this for me when she saw it at a shop, just as a little gift.

author: Huge_Nerd
title: It's got that something special...
review:
My girlfriend and I had seen this guy often at the store and we always made fun of him and his pathetic little rock, but we started to like him in an underdog kind of way. So much to surprise, she got him for me for St. Nicholas Day (which we treat as an appetizer to Christmas). He's my only Atlantis set (I collect Star Wars Lego). Strangely enough, I love this guy!

Yes, objectively this is a terrible set, but I am having a blast with him. His colors and look make him an awesome mascot for my favorite baseball team (the Tampa Bay Rays). He also looks great, especially scalewise, leading my Seacons (Transformers)--or at least trying too, lol. Plus, his rock and seaweed has the uncanny ability to make any toy I place next to it appear underwater.

So in conclusion, yeay he's lame, but I love him!

author: AETerry
title: Manta Warrior
review:
I love the Atlantis line that's out this year and last year. So buying this small figure is part of getting a complete set.

I also bought two. I'd have liked it better if it were more cheaply priced, loose the rock and have just the figure. That's what I bought it for, the minifig so I could do army building with Atlantis.

Now, if they'd have more of the Shark Warriors in the sets.

Still, $4.99 isn't all that bad, it's comparable to the Collectible Minifigures line as there is an actual slight build to it.

Instructions

The instructions are on a folded sheet of paper with very easy to follow step-by-step illustrations.

Parts

You get 13 pieces in all for this set, most notable and best being the trident accessory and the green vine piece for kelp or seaweed.

Minifigures

You get one minifigure, that of the Mantis Warrior.

The build

There really isn't much to this set, you get it mainly for the minifigure and just enough pieces to suggest and depict an underwater scene.

author: Odeinoichus
title: A Manta Warrior stands alone.
review:
Set #8073 Manta Warrior: UGH, just... Ugh. This should have been one of the Collectible Mini-Figures, at least dollar value wise you'd be getting a better deal than this Impulse set. Why? Because it's only 13 pieces, but you're paying 5$ for it. Of course it is a decent little troop builder for your Atlantis theme, but only if you can get it on sale at 50% off or something.

 

Don't get me wrong, I enjoy the Impulse sets and will gladly keep buying every one of them no matter what, but I would have thought that this Manta Warrior could have at least been given something to interact with more than just a little underwater plant life.

 

As a proper comparison allow me to bring up another little set I once owned. It was from the Divers Sub-Theme and it included one mini-figure, a life raft/miniatrue motor boat, a sword-fish type shark, three jewels and an underwater plant and it cost about the same price as this embarrassment to the Impulse set theme. That set at least gave you your money's worth, LEGO should have included an Atlantis Key with this set and maybe given you something to build like a mini-sub or something. Anything would be better than this.

 

Still if you can pick this up on sale you won't hate it, you just won't love it too much, though the Manta Warrior is a pretty neat little Mini-Figure. Who am I kidding? At full price I'd probably still buy two or three of this set. But that's just me. And not all Impusle sets can be great.

author: HeroFactoryDude316
title: What was the point of this?
review:
This set makes no sense at all. I don't even know why I wasted my money buying it.


Building experience: Ug. There's like nothing to even build. All you do is build a tiny rock and a figure. 1/5


Parts: The parts aren't great either. The only good thing is the manta warrior. The rock is just like something you don't even need. 2/5


Playability: Gee. There's absolutely no playability. Get another set with this. It might add some more playability. 1/5


Money value: FIVE dollars for this tiny thing! I mean it's outrageous! A waste of money! Save up for something else than buy this. 1/5


Overall: Overall it's a horrible set. I wouldn't buy it. Like I said it's a waste of money. Overall I say a 1/5.

author: LEGOMinifigures1997
title: Cheap way to get the Manta Warrior minifigure
review:
I got this set when I was in a store and I saw this set for only â‚¬3,- I bought it because I wanted the Manta Warrior and this is a cheap way to get him.

This is a nice little set with the Manta Warrior and a rock.

The Manta Warrior has a new piece for on his head (I expected that this piece was attached to his head to make one head piece, but it's a kind of hat) and has a nice trident. He really looks like a mutant-manta-man.

The rock is a nice little complement with some seaweed on it. Not much to say about it.

Pros

  • Manta Warrior looks awesome
  • Rock was a little bit larger than I expected
  • Nice complement for your Atlantis collection
  • Cheap way to get the Manta Warrior

Cons

  • None!

Summary this is a nice set and if you see it in a store, just buy it!

author: EpicMindvolt
title: Nice additional set.
review:
This set is pretty good except for the fact that its tiny.

Box/Instructions

The box is like the normal small sets like this one, and the instructions look kind of like a postcard.

 

 

Parts

Not really good or rare parts except the minifigure pieces.

 

Minifigures

The minifigure is awesome looking.

 

The build

I didn't build this set because I can build one anyway with all the spare bricks I have. So I kept it in the box.

 

The completed model

Great except for the little pile of rocks.

 

Overall opinion

I like this set, because you can add it with other Atlantis sets for more playability. I never opened it, and I only wanted it because it is the smallest set ever produced in a box(I think). Also, it is worth about $7 (USD) in the box. I recommend this set to everyone, except if you buy it, get another Atlantis set along with it. Overall I give this set a 2-3 out of five stars depending on how you use it.

author: LegoHobbitFan
title: A Small Companion to the Larger Sets
review:
On it's own this set isn't the best. It consists of a Manta Warrior minifigure and a small rock clump with some seaweed. The set only consists of 13 pieces, almost none of which are even slightly rare. The figure itself is the only interesting part, and even it appears in many Atlantis sets and is fairly cheap. It also doesn't really provide much play value on it's own.

However, when paired with some of the larger sets it could make a nice space filler in a diorama or a small companion set for play. So it all depends on how you look at it. By itself it is not worth it, but paired up with some other sets it can add a little extra value. I hope you find this review helpful!
